class.name: Callable
class.brief_description: A built-in type representing a method or a standalone function.

constructor.name: Callable
constructor.description: Constructs an empty [Callable], with no object nor method bound.

constructor.name: Callable
constructor.description: Constructs a [Callable] as a copy of the given [Callable].

constructor.name: Callable
constructor.description: Creates a new [Callable] for the method named [param method] in the specified [param object].

method.name: bind
method.description: Returns a copy of this [Callable] with one or more arguments bound. When called, the bound arguments are passed [i]after[/i] the arguments supplied by [method call]. See also [method unbind]. [b]Note:[/b] When this method is chained with other similar methods, the order in which the argument list is modified is read from right to left.

method.name: bindv
method.description: Returns a copy of this [Callable] with one or more arguments bound, reading them from an array. When called, the bound arguments are passed [i]after[/i] the arguments supplied by [method call]. See also [method unbind]. [b]Note:[/b] When this method is chained with other similar methods, the order in which the argument list is modified is read from right to left.

method.name: call
method.description: Calls the method represented by this [Callable]. Arguments can be passed and should match the method's signature.

method.name: call_deferred
method.description: Calls the method represented by this [Callable] in deferred mode, i.e. at the end of the current frame. Arguments can be passed and should match the method's signature. [codeblock] func _ready(): grab_focus.call_deferred() [/codeblock] See also [method Object.call_deferred].

method.name: callv
method.description: Calls the method represented by this [Callable]. Unlike [method call], this method expects all arguments to be contained inside the [param arguments] [Array].

method.name: get_bound_arguments
method.description: Return the bound arguments (as long as [method get_bound_arguments_count] is greater than zero), or empty (if [method get_bound_arguments_count] is less than or equal to zero).

method.name: get_bound_arguments_count
method.description: Returns the total amount of arguments bound (or unbound) via successive [method bind] or [method unbind] calls. If the amount of arguments unbound is greater than the ones bound, this function returns a value less than zero.

method.name: get_method
method.description: Returns the name of the method represented by this [Callable]. If the callable is a GDScript lambda function, returns the function's name or [code]"<anonymous lambda>"[/code].

method.name: get_object
method.description: Returns the object on which this [Callable] is called.

method.name: get_object_id
method.description: Returns the ID of this [Callable]'s object (see [method Object.get_instance_id]).

method.name: hash
method.description: Returns the 32-bit hash value of this [Callable]'s object. [b]Note:[/b] [Callable]s with equal content will always produce identical hash values. However, the reverse is not true. Returning identical hash values does [i]not[/i] imply the callables are equal, because different callables can have identical hash values due to hash collisions. The engine uses a 32-bit hash algorithm for [method hash].

method.name: is_custom
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Callable] is a custom callable. Custom callables are created from [method bind] or [method unbind]. In GDScript, lambda functions are also custom callables.

method.name: is_null
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Callable] has no target to call the method on.

method.name: is_standard
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Callable] is a standard callable. This method is the opposite of [method is_custom]. Returns [code]false[/code] if this callable is a lambda function.

method.name: is_valid
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the callable's object exists and has a valid method name assigned, or is a custom callable.

method.name: rpc
method.description: Perform an RPC (Remote Procedure Call) on all connected peers. This is used for multiplayer and is normally not available, unless the function being called has been marked as [i]RPC[/i] (using [annotation @GDScript.@rpc] or [method Node.rpc_config]). Calling this method on unsupported functions will result in an error. See [method Node.rpc].

method.name: rpc_id
method.description: Perform an RPC (Remote Procedure Call) on a specific peer ID (see multiplayer documentation for reference). This is used for multiplayer and is normally not available unless the function being called has been marked as [i]RPC[/i] (using [annotation @GDScript.@rpc] or [method Node.rpc_config]). Calling this method on unsupported functions will result in an error. See [method Node.rpc_id].

method.name: unbind
method.description: Returns a copy of this [Callable] with a number of arguments unbound. In other words, when the new callable is called the last few arguments supplied by the user are ignored, according to [param argcount]. The remaining arguments are passed to the callable. This allows to use the original callable in a context that attempts to pass more arguments than this callable can handle, e.g. a signal with a fixed number of arguments. See also [method bind]. [b]Note:[/b] When this method is chained with other similar methods, the order in which the argument list is modified is read from right to left. [codeblock] func _ready(): foo.unbind(1).call(1, 2) # Calls foo(1). foo.bind(3, 4).unbind(1).call(1, 2) # Calls foo(1, 3, 4), note that it does not change the arguments from bind. [/codeblock]

operator.name: operator !=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if both [Callable]s invoke different targets.

operator.name: operator ==
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if both [Callable]s invoke the same custom target.
